desc.name: FRBRExpression
desc.comment: The element FRBRExpression is the metadata container of identifying properties related to the Expression level according to the FRBR hierarchy

desc.name: FRBRItem
desc.comment: The element FRBRItem is the metadata container of identifying properties related to the Item level according to the FRBR hierarchy.

desc.name: FRBRManifestation
desc.comment: The element FRBRManifestation is the metadata container of identifying properties related to the Manifestation level according to the FRBR hierarchy

desc.name: FRBRWork
desc.comment: The element FRBRWork is the metadata container of identifying properties related to the Work level according to the FRBR hierarchy

desc.name: FRBRalias
desc.comment: The element FRBRalias is the metadata property containing additional well-known names of the document in the respective level of the FRBR hierarchy

desc.name: FRBRauthor
desc.comment: The element FRBRauthor is the metadata property containing a relevant author of the document in the respective level of the FRBR hierarchy. Attribute as specifies the role of the author.

desc.name: FRBRauthoritative
desc.comment: The element FRBRauthoritative is the metadata property containing a boolean value to determine whether the document contains authoritative text (i.e., content that is the official, authoritative product of an official workflow from an entity that is entrusted with generating an official, authoriative version of the document.

desc.name: FRBRcountry
desc.comment: The element FRBRcountry is the metadata property containing a ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 code for the country or jurisdiction to be used in the work-level IRI of this document

desc.name: FRBRdate
desc.comment: The element FRBRdate is the metadata property containing a relevant date of the document in the respective level of the FRBR hierarchy. Attribute name specifies which actual date is contained here.

desc.name: FRBRformat
desc.comment: The element FRBRformat is the metadata property containing the Internet Media Type specification for the data format to be used in the manifestation-level IRI of this document.

desc.name: FRBRlanguage
desc.comment: The element FRBRlanguage is the metadata property containing a RFC4646 (three-letter code) of the main human language used in the content of this expression

desc.name: FRBRmasterExpression
desc.comment: The element FRBRmasterExpression is the metadata property identifying the master expression, i.e., the expression whose ids are used as permanent ids in the wId attributes. An expression without the FRBRmasterExpression element is considered a master expression itself, i.e., the first version, or the most important version, of a document expressed in the only language, or in the most important language. Any other situation (subsequent versions, or language variants, or content variants) must have the FRBRmasterExpression element pointing to the URI of the master expression. If the FRBRmasterEpression is specified, but without a href pointing to the masterExpression, it is assumed that NO master expression exist in reality, but an UR-Expression exist, whose ids are used in this expression as wIds.

desc.name: FRBRname
desc.comment: The element FRBRname is the metadata property containing a string for the title to be used in the work-level IRI of this document

desc.name: FRBRnumber
desc.comment: The element FRBRnumber is the metadata property containing a string or number for the number to be used in the work-level IRI of this document

desc.name: FRBRportion
desc.comment: The element FRBRportion is the metadata property containing the eId of the portion contained in a manifestation-level portion. If the portion contains an interval of elements, the range attributes specifies the first and last one.

desc.name: FRBRprescriptive
desc.comment: The element FRBRprescriptive is the metadata property containing a boolean value to determine whether the document contains prescriptive text (i.e., text that is or might become prescriptive, such as an act or a bill) or not (such as, for instance, a non-normative resolution from an assembly.

desc.name: FRBRsubtype
desc.comment: The element FRBRsubtype is the metadata property containing a string for the specific subtype of the document to be used in the work-level IRI of this document

desc.name: FRBRthis
desc.comment: The element FRBRthis is the metadata property containing the IRI of the specific component of the document

desc.name: FRBRtranslation
desc.comment: The element FRBRtranslation is the metadata property specifying the source of which this expression is a translation of.

desc.name: FRBRuri
desc.comment: The element FRBRuri is the metadata property containing the IRI of the whole document.

desc.name: FRBRversionNumber
desc.comment: The element FRBRversionNumber is the metadata property containing the value of the version number if appropriate to identify the specific expression here contained. It allows an arbitrary string.

desc.name: TLCConcept
desc.comment: The element TLCConcept is a metadata reference to the Akoma Ntoso IRI of an ontology instance of the class Concept

desc.name: TLCEvent
desc.comment: The element TLCEvent is a metadata reference to the Akoma Ntoso IRI of an ontology instance of the class Event

desc.name: TLCLocation
desc.comment: The element TLCLocation is a metadata reference to the Akoma Ntoso IRI of an ontology instance of the class Location

desc.name: TLCObject
desc.comment: The element TLCObject is a metadata reference to the Akoma Ntoso IRI of an ontology instance of the class Object

desc.name: TLCOrganization
desc.comment: The element TLCOrganization is a metadata reference to the Akoma Ntoso IRI of an ontology instance of the class Organization

desc.name: TLCPerson
desc.comment: The element TLCPerson is a metadata reference to the Akoma Ntoso IRI of an ontology instance of the class Person

desc.name: TLCProcess
desc.comment: The element TLCProcess is a metadata reference to the Akoma Ntoso IRI of an ontology instance of the class Process

desc.name: TLCReference
desc.comment: The element TLCreference is a generic metadata reference to the Akoma Ntoso IRI of an ontology instance of a class specified through the name attribute

desc.name: TLCRole
desc.comment: The element TLCRole is a metadata reference to the Akoma Ntoso IRI of an ontology instance of the class Role

desc.name: TLCTerm
desc.comment: The element TLCTerm is a metadata reference to the Akoma Ntoso IRI of an ontology instance of the class Term

desc.name: a
desc.comment: The element a is an HTML element and is used in Akoma Ntoso as in HTML, for the generic link to a web resource (NOT to an Akoma Ntoso document: use ref for that). It is an inline.

desc.name: abbr
desc.comment: The element abbr is an HTML element and is used in Akoma Ntoso as in HTML, for the specification of an abbreviation or an acronym (an inline). As in HTML, use attribute title to specify the full expansion of the abbreviation or acronym.

desc.name: act
desc.comment: Element act is used for describing the structure and content of an act

desc.name: activeModifications
desc.comment: The element activeModifications is a metadata container of the active modifications generated by the document.

desc.name: activeRef
desc.comment: The element activeRef is a metadata reference to the Akoma Ntoso IRI of a document that is modified by this document (i.e., an active references)

desc.name: address
desc.comment: this element is a structural container for parts of a debates that are relevant to addresses

desc.name: adjournment
desc.comment: this element is a structural container for parts of a debates that contain adjournment notices

desc.name: administrationOfOath
desc.comment: this element is a structural container for parts of a debates that contain the administration of an oath

desc.name: affectedDocument
desc.comment: the element affectedDocument is an inline element within preamble to identify the document that this amendment affects

desc.name: akomaNtoso
desc.comment: NAME akomaNtoso the element akomaNtoso is the root element of all document types in Akoma Ntoso. It follows the pattern Universal Root (http://www.xmlpatterns.com/UniversalRootMain.shtml)

desc.name: alinea
desc.comment: this element is a hierarchical container called "alinea" either explicitly or due to the local tradition

desc.name: alternativeReference
desc.comment: The element alternativeReference contains an alternative reference (e.g., using a different namespace) for a legal reference.

desc.name: amendment
desc.comment: Element amendment is used for describing the structure and content of an amendment

desc.name: amendmentBody
desc.comment: the element amendmentBody is the container of the main hierarchy of a amendment document

desc.name: amendmentContent
desc.comment: this element is a structural container for the section of an amendment containing the actual amendment text

desc.name: amendmentHeading
desc.comment: this element is a structural container for the section of an amendment containing the heading

desc.name: amendmentJustification
desc.comment: this element is a structural container for the section of an amendment containing the justification

desc.name: amendmentList
desc.comment: Element amendmentList is used for describing the structure and content of a collection of amendments

desc.name: amendmentReference
desc.comment: this element is a structural container for the section of an amendment containing the reference

desc.name: answer
desc.comment: the element answer is a container of a single official answer to a question

desc.name: application
desc.comment: The element application is a metadata element specifying the period of the application modification.

desc.name: applies
desc.comment: The element applies is a metadata element specifying a reference to a source applyed by the argument being described.

desc.name: argument
desc.comment: the element argument is an inline element within judgments for classifying the arguments in the motivation part of the judgment

desc.name: arguments
desc.comment: this element is a structural container for the section of a judgment containing the arguments

desc.name: article
desc.comment: this element is a hierarchical container called "article" either explicitly or due to the local tradition

desc.name: attachment
desc.comment: the element attachment is used as a container of individual attachment elements

desc.name: attachmentOf
desc.comment: The element attachmentOf is a metadata reference to the Akoma Ntoso IRI of a document of which this document is an attachment

desc.name: authorialNote
desc.comment: the element authorialNote is a subFlow element containing an authorial (non-editorial) note in the main flow of the text.

desc.name: b
desc.comment: The element b is an HTML element and is used in Akoma Ntoso as in HTML, for the bold style (an inline)

desc.name: background
desc.comment: this element is a structural container for the section of a judgment containing the background

desc.name: bill
desc.comment: Element bill is used for describing the structure and content of a bill

desc.name: block
desc.comment: the element block is a generic element for a block. It can be placed in a container instead of any of the other blocks. The attribute name is required and gives a name to the element.

desc.name: blockContainer
desc.comment: the element blockContainer is used as a container of many individual block elements in a block context

desc.name: blockList
desc.comment: the element blockList is used as in a block context as a container of many individual item elements to be treated as in a list

desc.name: body
desc.comment: the element body is the container of the main hierarchy of a hierarchical document (e.g, an act or a bill)

desc.name: book
desc.comment: this element is a hierarchical container called "book" either explicitly or due to the local tradition

desc.name: br
desc.comment: The element br is an HTML element and is used in Akoma Ntoso as in HTML, for the breaking of a line

desc.name: caption
desc.comment: The element caption is an HTML element and is used in Akoma Ntoso as in HTML, for the caption of a table (a block)

desc.name: change
desc.comment: the element change is an inline element that identifies the changes expressed in the two columns of an amendment document

desc.name: chapter
desc.comment: this element is a hierarchical container called "chapter" either explicitly or due to the local tradition

desc.name: citation
desc.comment: the element citation is the individual element of the preface that is called citation

desc.name: citations
desc.comment: the element citations is the section of the preamble that contains citations

desc.name: clause
desc.comment: this element is a hierarchical container called "clause" either explicitly or due to the local tradition

desc.name: collectionBody
desc.comment: the element collectionBody is the container of a list of other documents (e.g, acts, bills, amendments, etc.) possibly interspersed with interstitial elements with content that does not form an individual document

desc.name: communication
desc.comment: this element is a structural container for parts of a debates that contain communications from the house

desc.name: component
desc.comment: The element component is a container of a subdocument specified in a composite document

desc.name: componentRef
desc.comment: the element componentRef is a reference to a separate manifestation-level resource that holds the content of the component of the document not physically placed at the position specified. Actual resources can either be external (e.g. in the package or even in a different position) or internal (within the components element)

desc.name: concept
desc.comment: The element concept is is an inline element to identify a text fragment introducing or referring to a concept in the ontology

desc.name: conclusions
desc.comment: the element conclusion is used as a container of all concluding material (e.g. dates, signatures, formulas, etc.)

desc.name: condition
desc.comment: The element condition is a metadata element specifying an open set of conditions on the modification (non managed by Akoma Ntoso).

desc.name: container
desc.comment: the element container is a generic element for a container.

desc.name: content
desc.comment: the element content is the final container in a hierarchy, and is where the blocks of text of the content of the structure are finally specified

desc.name: contrasts
desc.comment: The element contrasts is a metadata element specifying a reference to a source contrasted by the argument being described.

desc.name: count
desc.comment: The element count is a metadata container containing the value of a count in a vote or a quorum verification.

desc.name: courtType
desc.comment: the element courtType is an inline element within judgments to identify the string used by the document for the type of the court doing the judgment

desc.name: coverPage
desc.comment: the element coverPage is used as a container of the text that acts as a cover page

desc.name: crossHeading
desc.comment: the element crossHeading is a heading element that is placed side by side with hierarchical containers .

desc.name: debate
desc.comment: Element debate is used for describing the structure and content of a debate record

desc.name: debateBody
desc.comment: the element debateBody is the container of the main hierarchy of a debate

desc.name: debateReport
desc.comment: Element debateReport is used for describing the structure and content of a report

desc.name: debateSection
desc.comment: this element is a generic structural container for all other parts of a debates that are not explicitly supported with a named element

desc.name: decision
desc.comment: this element is a structural container for the section of a judgment containing the decision

desc.name: declarationOfVote
desc.comment: this element is a structural container for parts of a debates that are relevant to the declaration of votes

desc.name: decoration
desc.comment: the element decoration is an inline element to represent a decorative aspect that is present in the orignal text and that is meant as additional information to the text (e.g., the annotation 'new' on the side of a freshly inserted structure.

desc.name: def
desc.comment: the element def is an inline element used for the definition of a term used in the rest of the document

desc.name: del
desc.comment: the element del is an inline element for the specification of editorial deletions

desc.name: derogates
desc.comment: The element derogates is a metadata element specifying a reference to a source derogated by the argument being described.

desc.name: destination
desc.comment: The element destination is a metadata element specifying the IRI of the destination of the modification.

desc.name: dissentsFrom
desc.comment: The element dissentsFrom is a metadata element specifying a reference to a source dissented from the argument being described.

desc.name: distinguishes
desc.comment: The element distinguishes is a metadata element specifying a reference to a source being distinguished by the argument being described.

desc.name: div
desc.comment: The element div is an HTML element, but is NOT used in Akoma Ntoso as in HTML. Instead of being used as a generic block, Akoma Ntoso uses div as a generic container (as in common practice)

desc.name: division
desc.comment: this element is a hierarchical container called "division" either explicitly or due to the local tradition

desc.name: doc
desc.comment: Element doc is used for describing the structure and content of any other document that is not included in the list of document explicitly managed by Akoma Ntoso

desc.name: docAuthority
desc.comment: the element docAuthority is an inline element within preface to identify the string used by the document detailing the Auhtority to which the document was submitted

desc.name: docCommittee
desc.comment: the element docCommittee is an inline element within preface to identify the string used by the document detailing the committee within which the document originated

desc.name: docDate
desc.comment: the element docDate is an inline element within preface to identify the string used by the document for its own date(s). Documents with multiple dates may use multiple docDate elements.

desc.name: docIntroducer
desc.comment: the element docIntroducer is an inline element within preface to identify the string used by the document detailing the individual introducing of the document

desc.name: docJurisdiction
desc.comment: the element docJurisdiction is an inline element within preface to identify the string used by the document detailing the jurisdiction of the document

desc.name: docNumber
desc.comment: the element docNumber is an inline element within preface to identify the string used by the document for its own number

desc.name: docProponent
desc.comment: the element docProponent is an inline element within preface to identify the string used by the document for its proponent

desc.name: docPurpose
desc.comment: the element docPurpose is an inline element within preface to identify the string used by the document detailing its own purpose

desc.name: docStage
desc.comment: the element docStage is an inline element within preface to identify the string used by the document detailing the stage in which the document sits

desc.name: docStatus
desc.comment: the element docStatus is an inline element within preface to identify the string used by the document detailing the status of the document

desc.name: docTitle
desc.comment: the element docTitle is an inline element within preface to identify the string used by the document for its own title

desc.name: docType
desc.comment: the element docType is an inline element within preface to identify the string used by the document for its own type

desc.name: docketNumber
desc.comment: the element docketNumber is an inline element within preface to identify the string used by the document for the number of the docket, case, file, etc which the document belongs to

desc.name: documentCollection
desc.comment: Element documentCollection is used for describing the structure and content of a collection of other documents chosen and combined for any reason whatsoever

desc.name: documentRef
desc.comment: the element documentRef is a reference to a separate work- or expression-level resource that should be placed in this position. Actual resources are external (e.g. in the package or even in a different position) and are (an expression or any expression of) a separate Work.

desc.name: domain
desc.comment: The element domain is a metadata element containing (in some non-managed form) the domain to which the modification applies.

desc.name: duration
desc.comment: The element duration is a metadata element specifying the period of the duration modification.

desc.name: efficacy
desc.comment: The element efficacy is a metadata element specifying the period of the efficacy modification.

desc.name: efficacyMod
desc.comment: The element efficacyMod is a metadata element specifying an (active or passive) modification in efficacy for the document.

desc.name: embeddedStructure
desc.comment: the element embeddedStructure is a subFlow element containing a full structure used as an extract from another document or position. Attribute quote is used to specify the quote character used in the original; no quote attribute implies that the quote is left in the text; quote="" implies that there is no quote character.

desc.name: embeddedText
desc.comment: the element embeddedText is an inline element containing a string used as an extract from another document. Attribute quote is used to specify the quote character used in the original; no quote attribute implies that the quote is left in the text; quote="" implies that there is no quote character.

desc.name: entity
desc.comment: the element entity is a generic inline element to identify a text fragment introducing or referring to a concept in the ontology

desc.name: eol
desc.comment: the element eol (end of line) is a marker for where in the original text the line breaks. If the line breaks within a word, place the element BEFORE the word and place the number of characters before the break in the attribute breakAt. One can also specify, if relevant, the hyphen or other character used to signal the break of a word at the end of the line with the attribute breakWith.

desc.name: eop
desc.comment: the element eop (end of page) is a marker for where in the original text the page breaks. Do NOT use a eol element, too. If the page breaks within a word, place the element BEFORE the word and place the number of characters before the break in the attribute breakAt. One can also specify, if relevant, the hyphen or other character used to signal the break of a word at the end of the page with the attribute breakWith.

desc.name: event
desc.comment: The element event is an inline element to identify a text fragment introducing or referring to an event in the ontology

desc.name: eventRef
desc.comment: The element eventRef is a metadata element specifying facts about an event that had an effect on the document. For each event, a date, a type and a document that generated the event must be referenced.

desc.name: extends
desc.comment: The element extends is a metadata element specifying a reference to a source extended by the argument being described.

desc.name: fillIn
desc.comment: the element fillIn is an inline element shown as a dotted line or any other typoaphical characteristics to represent a fill-in element in a printed form, that is as ane example of an actual form. It is NOT meant to be used for form elements as in HTML, i.e. as a way to collect input from the reader and deliver to some server-side process.

desc.name: force
desc.comment: The element force is a metadata element specifying the period of the force modification.

desc.name: forceMod
desc.comment: The element forceMod is a metadata element specifying an (active or passive) modification in force for the document.

desc.name: foreign
desc.comment: the element foreign is a generic container for elements not belonging to the Akoma Ntoso namespace (e.g., mathematical formulas). It is a block element and thus can be placed in a container.

desc.name: formula
desc.comment: the element formula is a section of the preface or preamble that contains a formulaic expression that is systematically or frequently present in a preface or a preamble and has e precise legal meaning (e.g. an enacting formula). Use the refersTo attribute for the specification of the actual type of formula.

desc.name: from
desc.comment: the element from is a heading element in a debate that contains the name or role or a reference to the person doing the speech

desc.name: hasAttachment
desc.comment: The element hasAttachment is a metadata reference to the Akoma Ntoso IRI of an attachment of this document

desc.name: hcontainer
desc.comment: the element hcontainer is a generic element for a hierarchical container. It can be placed in a hierarchy instead of any of the other hierarchical containers. The attribute name is required and gives a name to the element.

desc.name: header
desc.comment: the element header is used as a container of all prefacing material of judgments (e.g. headers, formulas, etc.)

desc.name: heading
desc.comment: the element heading is a heading element in a hierarchy that contains a title or any other textual content to describe the structure.

desc.name: date
desc.comment: the element date is an inline element to identify a date expressed in the text and to propose a normalized representation in the date attribute.

desc.name: inline
desc.comment: the element inline is a generic element for an inline. It can be placed inside a block instead of any of the other inlines. The attribute name is required and gives a name to the element.

desc.name: level
desc.comment: this element is a hierarchical container called "level" either explicitly or due to the local tradition

desc.name: outcome
desc.comment: the element outcome is an inline that wraps the outcome of a vote

desc.name: role
desc.comment: The element role is an inline element to identify a text fragment introducing or referring to a role in the ontology

desc.name: source
desc.comment: The element source is a metadata element specifying the IRI of the source of the modification.

desc.name: time
desc.comment: the element time is an inline element to identify a time expressed in the text and to propose a normalized representation in the time attribute.

desc.name: i
desc.comment: The element i is an HTML element and is used in Akoma Ntoso as in HTML, for the italic style (an inline)

desc.name: img
desc.comment: The element img is an HTML element and is used in Akoma Ntoso as in HTML, for including an image. It is a marker.

desc.name: implicitReference
desc.comment: The element implicitReference contains a legal reference to a document that is not explicitly mentioned in the content of the document.

desc.name: indent
desc.comment: this element is a hierarchical container called "indent" either explicitly or due to the local tradition

desc.name: ins
desc.comment: the element ins is an inline element for the specification of editorial insertions

desc.name: interstitial
desc.comment: the element interstitial is used as a container of text elements and blocks that are placed for any reason between individual documents in a collection of documents

desc.name: intro
desc.comment: the element intro is a heading element in a hierarchy that contains paragraphs introducing one or more lower hierarchical elements.

desc.name: introduction
desc.comment: this element is a structural container for the section of a judgment containing introductory material

desc.name: isAnalogTo
desc.comment: The element isAnalogTo is a metadata element specifying a reference to a source analog to the argument being described.

desc.name: item
desc.comment: The element item is a container belonging to a blockList

desc.name: judge
desc.comment: the element judge is an inline element within judgments to identify where the document defines one of the judges, and his/her role

desc.name: judgment
desc.comment: Element judgment is used for describing the structure and content of a judgment

desc.name: judgmentBody
desc.comment: the element judgmentBody is the container of the main hierarchy of a judgment document

desc.name: judicial
desc.comment: The element judicial is a metadata container of the analysis of the judicial arguments of a judgment.

desc.name: jurisprudence
desc.comment: The element jurisprudence is a metadata reference to the Akoma Ntoso IRI of a document providing jurisprudence on this document

desc.name: keyword
desc.comment: The element keyword is a metadata element specifying a keyword associated to the FRBR expression of the document. Attribute dictionary (required) specifies the thesaurus out of which the keyword has been taken. Attribute href points to the fragment of text this keyword is associated to. Keywords without href attribute refer to the content as a whole.

desc.name: lawyer
desc.comment: the element lawyer is an inline element within judgments to identify where the document defines one of the lawyers, his/her role, which party it represents, and the other lawyer, if any, this lawyer received the power delegation of power in some role

desc.name: legalSystemMod
desc.comment: The element legalSystemMod is a metadata element specifying an (active or passive) modification in the legal system for the document.

desc.name: legislature
desc.comment: the element legislature is an inline element within preface to identify the string used by the document for the legislature relative to the document. Use #refersTo to a TLCEvent to refer to the event of the specific legislature.

desc.name: li
desc.comment: TYPE Element NAME li The element li is an HTML element and is used in Akoma Ntoso as in HTML, for the generic list item (not a pattern)

desc.name: list
desc.comment: this element is a hierarchical container called "list" either explicitly or due to the local tradition

desc.name: listIntroduction
desc.comment: the element listIntroduction is an optional element of blockList before any item of the list itself.

desc.name: listWrapUp
desc.comment: the element listWrapUp is an optional element of blockList after all items of the list itself.

desc.name: location
desc.comment: The element location is an inline element to identify a text fragment introducing or referring to a location in the ontology

desc.name: longTitle
desc.comment: the element longTitle is the section of the preface or coverPage that is called long title

desc.name: mainBody
desc.comment: the element mainBody is the container of the main part of all other document types

desc.name: mapping
desc.comment: The element mapping contains a reference to the permanent wId (attribute original) of a structure, and to the eId (attribute current) such structure had during the time interval included between an initial temporalGroup and a final temporalGroup. This is useful for tracking the evolving ids of documents frequently renumbered (e,g., bills). Every single element whose wId does not match its eId needs to be represented here.

desc.name: marker
desc.comment: the element marker is a generic element for a marker. It can be placed in a block instead of any of the other markers. The attribute name is required and gives a name to the element.

desc.name: meaningMod
desc.comment: The element meaningMod is a metadata element specifying an (active or passive) modification in meaning for the document.

desc.name: ministerialStatements
desc.comment: this element is a structural container for parts of a debates that contain written statements by participants

desc.name: mmod
desc.comment: the element mmod is an inline element containing multiple specifications of modifications on another document

desc.name: mod
desc.comment: the element mod is an inline element containing the specification of a modification on another document

desc.name: motivation
desc.comment: this element is a structural container for the section of a judgment containing the motivation

desc.name: mref
desc.comment: the element mref is an inline element containing multiple references (each in turn represented by a ref element)

desc.name: narrative
desc.comment: the element narrative is a block element in a debate to mark description in the third person of events taking place in the meeting, e.g. "Mr X. takes the Chair"

desc.name: nationalInterest
desc.comment: this element is a structural container for parts of a debates that contain resolutions

desc.name: neutralCitation
desc.comment: the element neutralCitation is an inline element within judgments to identify the string declared by the document as being the neutral citation for the judgment

desc.name: new
desc.comment: The element new is a metadata element containing (in some non-managed form) the new text of the modification. Attribute href points to the eId of the element old it is substituting.

desc.name: note
desc.comment: The element note is a metadata element containing the text of the footnote and endnote specified.

desc.name: noteRef
desc.comment: the element noteRef is a reference to a editorial note placed in the notes metadata section

desc.name: noticesOfMotion
desc.comment: this element is a structural container for parts of a debates that are relevant to the notices of motions

desc.name: num
desc.comment: the element num is a heading element in a hierarchy that contains a number or any other ordered mechanism to identify the structure.

desc.name: object
desc.comment: The element object is is an inline element to identify a text fragment introducing or referring to an object in the ontology

desc.name: officialGazette
desc.comment: Element officialGazette is used for describing the structure and content of an issue of an official gazette

desc.name: ol
desc.comment: The element ol is an HTML element and is used in Akoma Ntoso as in HTML, for an ordered list of list item (elements li)

desc.name: old
desc.comment: The element old is a metadata element containing (in some non-managed form) the old text of the modification. Attribute href points to the eId of the element new it is being substituted by.

desc.name: omissis
desc.comment: the element omissis is an inline element for the specification of a text that substitutes a textual omission (e.g., dots, spaces, the word "omissis", etc.

desc.name: opinion
desc.comment: the element opinion is an inline element to identify where the document defines the opinion of an actor

desc.name: oralStatements
desc.comment: this element is a structural container for parts of a debates that contain oral statements by participants

desc.name: organization
desc.comment: The element organization is an inline element to identify a text fragment introducing or referring to an organization in the ontology

desc.name: original
desc.comment: The element original is a metadata reference to the Akoma Ntoso IRI of the original version of this document (i.e., the first expression)

desc.name: other
desc.comment: the element other is a container of parts of a debate that are not speeches, nor scene comments (e.g., lists of papers, etc.)

desc.name: otherAnalysis
desc.comment: The element otherAnalysis is a metadata container of any additional metadata analysis element that does not belong to the specific categories provided before. Anything can be placed in this element..

desc.name: overrules
desc.comment: The element overrules is a metadata element specifying a reference to a source overruled by the argument being described.

desc.name: p
desc.comment: The element p is an HTML element and is used in Akoma Ntoso as in HTML, for the generic paragraph of text (a block)

desc.name: papers
desc.comment: this element is a structural container for parts of a debates that are relevant to the display of papers

desc.name: paragraph
desc.comment: this element is a hierarchical container called "paragraph" either explicitly or due to the local tradition

desc.name: parliamentary
desc.comment: The element parliamentary is a metadata container of the analysis of the events of a debate.

desc.name: part
desc.comment: this element is a hierarchical container called "part" either explicitly or due to the local tradition

desc.name: party
desc.comment: the element party is an inline element within judgments to identify where the document defines one of the parties

desc.name: passiveModifications
desc.comment: The element passiveModifications is a metadata container of the passive modifications affecting the document.

desc.name: passiveRef
desc.comment: The element passiveRef is a metadata reference to the Akoma Ntoso IRI of a document providing modifications on this document (i.e., a passive references)

desc.name: person
desc.comment: the element person is an inline element to identify a text fragment introducing or referring to a person in the ontology. Attribute as allows to specify a TLCrole the person is holding in the context of the document's mention

desc.name: personalStatements
desc.comment: this element is a structural container for parts of a debates that contain written statements by participants

desc.name: petitions
desc.comment: this element is a structural container for parts of a debates that are relevant to petitions

desc.name: placeholder
desc.comment: the element placeholder is an inline element containing the text of a computable expression (e.g., '30 days after the publication of this act') that can be replaced editorially with an actual value

desc.name: point
desc.comment: this element is a hierarchical container called "point" either explicitly or due to the local tradition

desc.name: pointOfOrder
desc.comment: this element is a structural container for parts of a debates that are relevant to points of order

desc.name: portion
desc.comment: Element portion is used for describing the structure and content of an independent portion of a document

desc.name: portionBody
desc.comment: the element portionBody is the container of a portion of another document

desc.name: prayers
desc.comment: this element is a structural container for parts of a debates that contain prayers

desc.name: preamble
desc.comment: the element preamble is used as a container of the text that opens the main body of the document as a preamble

desc.name: preface
desc.comment: the element preface is used as a container of all prefacing material (e.g. headers, formulas, etc.)

desc.name: presentation
desc.comment: The element presentation is a metadata container of any presentation specification for the visual rendering of Akoam Ntoso elements. Anything can be placed in this element.

desc.name: preservation
desc.comment: The element preservation is the metadata property containing an arbitrary list of elements detailing the preservation actions taken for the document is the respective level of the FRBR hierarchy..

desc.name: previous
desc.comment: The element previous is a metadata element referring to the element (rather than the text) of the modification in the previous version of the document. This is especially useful when renumbering occurs, so as to specify the eId of the instance that was modified in the previous version. Attribute href points to the eId of the element being modified in the old version, using a full expression-level URI.

desc.name: proceduralMotions
desc.comment: this element is a structural container for parts of a debates that are relevant to procedural motions

desc.name: process
desc.comment: The element process is an inline element to identify a text fragment introducing or referring to a process in the ontology

desc.name: proprietary
desc.comment: The element proprietary is a metadata container of any additional metadata property that does not belong to the Akoma Ntoso properties. Anything can be placed in this element.

desc.name: proviso
desc.comment: this element is a hierarchical container called "proviso" either explicitly or due to the local tradition

desc.name: publication
desc.comment: The element publication is the metadata container specifying an official publication event for the FRBR expression of the document.

desc.name: putsInQuestion
desc.comment: The element putsInQuestions is a metadata element specifying a reference to a source questioned by the argument being described.

desc.name: quantity
desc.comment: The element quantity is an inline element to identify a text fragment introducing or referring to a quantity. This could be a dimensionless number, or a number referring to a length, weight, duration, etc. or even a sum of money. The attribute normalized contains the value normalized in a number, if appropriate.

desc.name: question
desc.comment: the element question is a container of a single official question as proposed by an MP to a person holding an official position

desc.name: questions
desc.comment: this element is a structural container for parts of a debates that are relevant to questions

desc.name: quorum
desc.comment: The element quorum is a metadata container containing the value of a quorum in a vote or a quorum verification.

desc.name: quorumVerification
desc.comment: The element quorumVerification is a metadata container containing information about an event of quorum verification happened within a debate.

desc.name: quotedStructure
desc.comment: the element quotedStructure is a subFlow element containing a full structure proposed as an insertion or a replacement. Attribute quote is used to specify the quote character used in the original; no quote attribute implies that the quote is left in the text; quote="" implies that there is no quote character. Attribute for is used in a mmod or rmod to point to the eId of the corresponding ref element.

desc.name: quotedText
desc.comment: the element quotedText is an inline element containing a small string that is used either as the text being replaced, or the replacement, or the positioning at which some modification should take place. Attribute quote is used to specify the quote character used in the original; no quote attribute implies that the quote is left in the text; quote="" implies that there is no quote character. Attribute for is used to point to the eId of the corresponding ref element.

desc.name: recital
desc.comment: the element recital is the individual element of the preface that is called recital

desc.name: recitals
desc.comment: the element recitals is the section of the preamble that contains recitals

desc.name: recordedTime
desc.comment: the element recordedTime is an inline element for the specification of an explicit mention of a time (e.g., in a debate)

desc.name: recount
desc.comment: The element recount is a metadata container containing information about an event of a recount happened within a debate.

desc.name: ref
desc.comment: the element ref is an inline element containing a legal reference

desc.name: references
desc.comment: The element references is a metadata container of all the references to entities external to the document mentioned in the document. They include references to legal documents of any form,a s well as references to people, organizations, events, roles, concepts, and anything else is managed by the Akoma Ntoso ontology.

desc.name: relatedDocument
desc.comment: the element relatedDocument is an inline element to identify the document for which this document is a report of

desc.name: remark
desc.comment: the element remark is an inline element for the specification of editorial remarks (e.g., applauses, laughters, etc.) especially within debate records

desc.name: remedies
desc.comment: this element is a structural container for the section of a judgment containing the remedies

desc.name: resolutions
desc.comment: this element is a structural container for parts of a debates that contain resolutions

desc.name: restriction
desc.comment: The element restriction specifies information about a restriction (such as a jurisdiction specification) by pointing to a specific legislative, geographic or temporal events through the refersTo attribute

desc.name: restricts
desc.comment: The element restricts is a metadata element specifying a reference to a source restricted by the argument being described.

desc.name: result
desc.comment: The element result is a metadata element specifying the overall result of the judgment.

desc.name: rmod
desc.comment: the element rmod is an inline element containing the specification of a range of modifications on another document

desc.name: rollCall
desc.comment: this element is a structural container for parts of a debates that contain a roll call of individuals

desc.name: rref
desc.comment: the element rref is an inline element containing a range of references between the IRI specified in the from attribute and the one specified in the upTo attribute.

desc.name: rule
desc.comment: this element is a hierarchical container called "rule" either explicitly or due to the local tradition

desc.name: scene
desc.comment: the element scene is a container of descriptions of the scene elements happening in a given moment during a debate (e.g., applauses)

desc.name: scopeMod
desc.comment: The element scopeMod is a metadata element specifying an (active or passive) modification in scope for the document.

desc.name: section
desc.comment: this element is a hierarchical container called "section" either explicitly or due to the local tradition

desc.name: session
desc.comment: the element session is an inline element within preface to identify the string used by the document for the session of the legislature relative to the document. Use #refersTo to a TLCEvent to refer to the event of the specific session.

desc.name: shortTitle
desc.comment: the element shortTitle is an inline element within preface to identify the string used by the document for the short title of the document.

desc.name: signature
desc.comment: the element signature is an inline element within conclusions to identify where the document defines one of the signatures

desc.name: span
desc.comment: The element span is an HTML element and is used in Akoma Ntoso as in HTML, for the generic inline

desc.name: speech
desc.comment: the element speech is a container of a single speech utterance in a debate. Dialogs between speakers need a speech element each

desc.name: speechGroup
desc.comment: the element speechGroup is a container of speech elements. This element is meant to pooint out, in a complex sequence of individual speech elements, the main contributor, i.e., the individual speech who was introducedand expected and that is causing the complex sequence that follows. Attributes by, as and to are those of the main speech.

desc.name: statement
desc.comment: Element statement is used for describing the structure and content of an official document of a body that may or may not be normative in structure (e.g., statements, resolutions, etc.).

desc.name: step
desc.comment: The element step is a metadata element specifying facts about a workflow step occurred to the document. For each event, a date, a type, an agent (and the corresponding role) that generated the action must be referenced. The outcome, too, can be specified.

desc.name: sub
desc.comment: The element sub is an HTML element and is used in Akoma Ntoso as in HTML, for the subscript style (an inline)

desc.name: subFlow
desc.comment: the element subFlow is a generic element for a subFlow.

desc.name: subchapter
desc.comment: this element is a hierarchical container called "subchapter" either explicitly or due to the local tradition

desc.name: subclause
desc.comment: this element is a hierarchical container called "subclause" either explicitly or due to the local tradition

desc.name: subdivision
desc.comment: this element is a hierarchical container called "subdivision" either explicitly or due to the local tradition

desc.name: subheading
desc.comment: the element subheading is a heading element in a hierarchy that contains a subtitle or any other textual content to further describe the structure.

desc.name: sublist
desc.comment: this element is a hierarchical container called "sublist" either explicitly or due to the local tradition

desc.name: subparagraph
desc.comment: this element is a hierarchical container called "subparagraph" either explicitly or due to the local tradition

desc.name: subpart
desc.comment: this element is a hierarchical container called "subpart" either explicitly or due to the local tradition

desc.name: subrule
desc.comment: this element is a hierarchical container called "subrule" either explicitly or due to the local tradition

desc.name: subsection
desc.comment: this element is a hierarchical container called "subsection" either explicitly or due to the local tradition

desc.name: subtitle
desc.comment: this element is a hierarchical container called "subtitle" either explicitly or due to the local tradition

desc.name: summary
desc.comment: the element summary is a block element in a debate to mark summaries of speeches that are individually not interesting (e.g.: "Question put and agreed to")

desc.name: sup
desc.comment: The element sup is an HTML element and is used in Akoma Ntoso as in HTML, for the superscript style (an inline)

desc.name: supports
desc.comment: The element supports is a metadata element specifying a reference to a source supported by the argument being described.

desc.name: tblock
desc.comment: The element tblock (titled block) is used to specify a container for blocks introduced by heading elements, similarly to a hierarchical structure

desc.name: td
desc.comment: The element td is an HTML element and is used in Akoma Ntoso as in HTML, for a data cell of a table

desc.name: term
desc.comment: The element term is an inline element to identify a text fragment introducing or referring to a term in the ontology

desc.name: textualMod
desc.comment: The element textualMod is a metadata element specifying an (active or passive) textual modification for the document.

desc.name: th
desc.comment: The element th is an HTML element and is used in Akoma Ntoso as in HTML, for a header cell of a table

desc.name: timeInterval
desc.comment: The element timeInterval contains all the data needed to identify a specific time interval. It is built either with two dates or with a date and a duration (exactly two of the 'start', 'end' and 'duration' attributes can be specified). Values of the 'start' and 'end' attributes are NOT dates, but references to event elements in the corresponding metadata section. The refers attribute is a reference to a temporal concept belonging to the Akoma Ntoso ontology and specified in the references section

desc.name: title
desc.comment: this element is a hierarchical container called "title" either explicitly or due to the local tradition

desc.name: tocItem
desc.comment: the element tocItem is a component of the table of content and contains header information about sections or parts of the rest of the document

desc.name: tome
desc.comment: this element is a hierarchical container called "tome" either explicitly or due to the local tradition

desc.name: transitional
desc.comment: this element is a hierarchical container called "transitional" either explicitly or due to the local tradition

desc.name: u
desc.comment: The element u is an HTML element and is used in Akoma Ntoso as in HTML, for the underline style (an inline)

desc.name: ul
desc.comment: The element ul is an HTML element and is used in Akoma Ntoso as in HTML, for an unordered list of list item (elements li)

desc.name: vote
desc.comment: the element vote is an inline that wraps either the name of the voter (when organized by choice) or the vote (when organized by name) in a voting report.

desc.name: voting
desc.comment: The element voting is a metadata container containing information about an event of a vote happened within a debate.

desc.name: wrapUp
desc.comment: the element wrapUp is a concluding element in a hierarchy that contains paragraphs wrapping up the preceding lower hierarchical elements.

desc.name: writtenStatements
desc.comment: this element is a structural container for parts of a debates that contain written statements by participants

desc.name: Amendments
desc.comment: The complex type Amendments is a list of all the amendment elements that can be used on a document analysis

desc.name: akomaNtosoType
desc.comment: the complex type akomaNtosoType is the type for the root element in Akoma Ntoso.

desc.name: althierarchy
desc.comment: The complex type althierarchy is used by most or all the hierarchical elements of documents that are not act-like.

desc.name: amendmentBodyType
desc.comment: the type amendmentBodyType specifies a content model of the main hierarchy of a amendment document

desc.name: amendmentStructure
desc.comment: the type amendmentStructure specifies the overall content model of the document types that describe amendments

desc.name: anyOtherType
desc.comment: the complex type anyOtherType defines an open content model for elements that may use elements from other namespaces.

desc.name: argumentType
desc.comment: the complex type argumentType defines the empty content model and the list of attributes for metadata elements in the analysis section

desc.name: basehierarchy
desc.comment: The complex type basehierarchy is not used by any element, but is derived by other types to contain the basic structure of hierarchical elements

desc.name: basicopt
desc.comment: the complex type basicopt defines the content model and attributes used by basic containers such as coverPage and conclusions. Here the eId attribute is optional

desc.name: blockContainerType
desc.comment: the blockContainerType is the type of element blockContainer

desc.name: blockListType
desc.comment: the blockListType is the type of element blockList

desc.name: blocksopt
desc.comment: the complex type blocksopt defines the content model and attributes shared by all containers. Here the eId attribute is optional

desc.name: blocksreq
desc.comment: the complex type blocksreq defines the content model and attributes shared by all containers. Here the eId attribute is required

desc.name: bodyType
desc.comment: the type bodyType specifies a content model of the main hierarchy of a hierarchical document (e.g, an act or a bill)

desc.name: booleanValueType
desc.comment: The type booleanValueType specifies a boolean value attribute to FRBR elements.

desc.name: collectionBodyType
desc.comment: the type collectionBodyType specifies a content model of a container of a list of other documents (e.g, acts, bills, amendments, etc.) possibly interspersed with interstitial elements with content that does not form an individual document

desc.name: collectionStructure
desc.comment: the type collectionStructure specifies the overall content model of the document types that are collections of other documents

desc.name: containerType
desc.comment: the complex type containerType is the content model for the generic element for a container. It can be placed in a container instead of any of the other containers. The attribute name is required and gives a name to the element.

desc.name: coreProperties
desc.comment: The complexType coreProperties lists the identifying properties available at any of the FRBR hierarchy levels.

desc.name: countType
desc.comment: The complex type countType lists all the properties associated to elements of parliamentary count.

desc.name: debateBodyType
desc.comment: the type debateBodyType specifies a content model of the main hierarchy of a debate

desc.name: debateStructure
desc.comment: the type debateStructure specifies the overall content model of the document types that describe debates

desc.name: docContainerType
desc.comment: the complex type docContainerType defines a shared content model for elements that contain whole documents, namely attachment, collectionItem, component.

desc.name: eolType
desc.comment: the complex type eolType is shared by eol and eop elements as being able to specify a hyphen character and a position within the next word in which the break can happen, and the number if any, associated to the page or line at issue

desc.name: hierarchicalStructure
desc.comment: the type hierarchicalStructure specifies the overall content model of the document types that are hierarchical in nature, especially acts and bills

desc.name: hierarchy
desc.comment: The complex type hierarchy is used by most or all the hierarchical elements of act-like documents.

desc.name: inline
desc.comment: the complex type inline defines the content model and attributes shared by all blocks and inlines. Here the eId attribute is optional

desc.name: inlinereq
desc.comment: the complex type inlinereq defines the content model and attributes shared by all blocks and inlines. Here the eId attribute is required

desc.name: inlinereqreq
desc.comment: the complex type inlinereq defines the content model and attributes shared by all blocks and inlines. Here the eId attribute is required and also the refersTo is required

desc.name: itemType
desc.comment: The complex type itemType is similar to a hierarchical element, but is isolated and does not belong to a full hierarchy.

desc.name: judgmentBodyType
desc.comment: the type judgmentBodyType specifies a content model of the main hierarchy of a judgment document

desc.name: judgmentStructure
desc.comment: the type judgmentStructure specifies the overall content model of the document types that describe judgments

desc.name: judicialArgumentType
desc.comment: The complex type judicialArgumentType lists all the properties associated to judicial elements.

desc.name: judicialArguments
desc.comment: The complex type judicialArguments is a list of all the judicial analysis elements that can be used on the analysis of a judgment

desc.name: linkType
desc.comment: the complex type linkType defines the empty content model and the list of attributes for Work- or Expression-level references to external resources

desc.name: listItems
desc.comment: the complex type listItems specifies the content model of elements ul and ol, and specifies just a sequence of list items (elements li).

desc.name: maincontent
desc.comment: the complex type maincontent is used by container elements that can contain basically any other Akoma Ntoso structure

desc.name: markeropt
desc.comment: the complex type markeropt defines the content model and attributes shared by all marker elements. Here the eId attribute is optional

desc.name: markerreq
desc.comment: the complex type markerreq defines the content model and attributes shared by all marker elements. Here the eId attribute is required

desc.name: metaopt
desc.comment: the complex type metaopt defines the content model and attributes shared by all metadata elements. Here the eId attribute is optional

desc.name: metareq
desc.comment: the complex type metareq defines the content model and attributes shared by all metadata elements. Here the eId attribute is required

desc.name: modType
desc.comment: the complex type modType specifies the content that is allowed within mod, mmod and rmod elements, i.e. it adds quotedText and quotedStructure to the normal list of inline elements. Attribute for is used to point to the eId of the corresponding ref element.

desc.name: modificationType
desc.comment: The complex type modificationType lists all the properties associated to modification elements.

desc.name: openStructure
desc.comment: the type openStructure specifies the overall content model of all the document types that do not have a specific and peculiar structure

desc.name: parliamentaryAnalysis
desc.comment: The complex type parliamentaryAnalysis is a list of all the parliamentary analysis elements that can be used on the analysis of a debate

desc.name: parliamentaryAnalysisType
desc.comment: The complex type parliamentaryAnalysisType lists all the properties associated to elements in the parliamentary analysis.

desc.name: periodType
desc.comment: the complex type periodType defines the empty content model and the list of attributes for metadata elements in the analysis section using periods

desc.name: portionBodyType
desc.comment: the type portionBodyType specifies a content model of a container of a portion of another document

desc.name: portionStructure
desc.comment: the type portionStructure specifies the overall content model of the document type that is a portion of another document

desc.name: preambleopt
desc.comment: the complex type preambleopt defines the content model and attributes used by preambles. Here the eId attribute is optional

desc.name: prefaceopt
desc.comment: the complex type prefaceopt defines the content model and attributes used by preface. Here the eId attribute is optional

desc.name: refItems
desc.comment: The complex type refItems is a list of types of references used in the references section.

desc.name: referenceType
desc.comment: the complex type referenceType defines the empty content model and the list of attributes for metadata elements in the references section

desc.name: speechType
desc.comment: the complex type speechType defines the content model and attributes shared by all speech elements. Here the eId attribute is optional

desc.name: srcType
desc.comment: the complex type srcType defines the empty content model and the list of attributes for manifestation-level references to external resources

desc.name: subFlowStructure
desc.comment: the type subFlowStructure specifies the overall content model of the elements that are subFlows

desc.name: valueType
desc.comment: The type valueType specifies a value attribute to FRBR elements.

desc.name: EfficacyMods
desc.comment: The simple type EfficacyMods lists all the types of modifications in efficacy as values for the type attribute of the efficacyMod element.

desc.name: ForceMods
desc.comment: The simple type ForceMods lists all the types of modifications in force as values for the type attribute of the forceMod element.

desc.name: LegalSystemMods
desc.comment: The simple type LegalSystemMods lists all the types of modifications in the legal system as values for the type attribute of the LegalSystemMod element.

desc.name: MeaningMods
desc.comment: The simple type MeaningMods lists all the types of modifications in meaning as values for the type attribute of the meaningMod element.

desc.name: ScopeMods
desc.comment: The simple type ScopeMods lists all the types of modifications in scope as values for the type attribute of the scopeMod element.

desc.name: TextualMods
desc.comment: The simple type TextualMods lists all the types of textual modifications as values for the type attribute of the textualMod element.

desc.name: agentRef
desc.comment: These values are references to existing agents (i.e., TLCPerson or TLCOrganization) only, i.e., given an existing eId of an agent of the form XYZ, the value is necessarily #XYZ

desc.name: conceptRef
desc.comment: These values are references to existing concepts (i.e., TLCConcept) only, i.e., given an existing eId of a concept of the form XYZ, the value is necessarily #XYZ

desc.name: eIdRef
desc.comment: These values are references to existing eIds only, i.e., given an existing eId of the form XYZ, the value is necessarily #XYZ

desc.name: eventRefRef
desc.comment: These values are references to existing event references (i.e., eventRef) only, i.e., given an existing eId of an eventRef of the form XYZ, the value is necessarily #XYZ

desc.name: eventType
desc.comment: This is the list of allowed values for the type attribute of the eventRef element

desc.name: language
desc.comment: This type specifies the human language in which the document the element refers to is expressed. Values are taken from the RFC 4646.

desc.name: opinionType
desc.comment: This is the list of allowed values for the type attribute of the opinion element

desc.name: remarkType
desc.comment: This is the list of allowed values for the type attribute of the remark element for the specification of editorial remarks (e.g., applauses, laughters, etc.) especially within debate records

desc.name: restrictionType
desc.comment: This is the list of allowed values for the restriction type attribute

desc.name: resultType
desc.comment: This is the list of allowed values for the type attribute of the result element

desc.name: manifestationURI
desc.comment: These values are references of a manifestation-Level document only

desc.name: noWhiteSpace
desc.comment: These values are those of ids such as eId, wId and GUID as a collection of any printable character except whitespaces.

desc.name: placementType
desc.comment: This is the list of allowed values for the placement attribute of notes

desc.name: posType
desc.comment: This is the list of possible positions of the text being analyzed by the element in the analysis section

desc.name: referenceRef
desc.comment: These values are references to existing References elements only, i.e., given an existing eId of an element of the References section of the form XYZ, the value is necessarily #XYZ

desc.name: roleRef
desc.comment: These values are references to existing roles (i.e., TLCRole) only, i.e., given an existing eId of a role of the form XYZ, the value is necessarily #XYZ

desc.name: statusType
desc.comment: This is the list of allowed values for the status attribute. This is the list of possible reasons for a dscrepancy between the manifestation as it should be (e.g., a faithful representation of the content of an expression), and the manifestation as it actually is. Values should be interpreted as follows: - removed: the content of the element is present in the markup (manifestation) but is not present in the real content of the document (expression level) because it has been definitely removed (either ex tunc, as in annullments, or ex nunc, as in abrogations). - temporarily removed: the content of the element is present in the markup (manifestation) but is not present in the real content of the document (expression level) because it has been temporarily removed (e.g., for a temporary suspension or limitation of efficacy). - translated: the content of the element is present in the markup (manifestation) in a different form than in the real content of the document (expression level) because it has been translated into a different language (e.g., to match the rest of the document or because of other editorial decisions). - editorial: the content of the element is present in the markup (manifestation) but is not present in the real content of the document (expression level) because it has been inserted as an editorial process when creating the XML markup. - edited: the content of the element is different in the markup (manifestation) than in the real content of the document (expression level) because it has been amended (e.g., to remove scurrilous or offensive remarks). - verbatim: the content of the element is present in the markup (manifestation) is EXACTLY as it was in the real content of the document (expression level) because usual silent fixes and edits were NOT performed (e.g. to punctuation, grammatical errors or other usually non-debatable problems). - incomplete: the content of the element or the value of a required attribute is NOT present in the markup (manifestation), although it should, because the missing data is not known at the moment, but in the future it might become known. This is especially appropriate for documents in drafting phase (e.g., the publication date of the act while drafting the bill) - unknown: the content of the element or the value of a required attribute is NOT present in the markup (manifestation), although it should, because the author of the manifestation does not know it. - undefined: the content of the element or the value of a required attribute is NOT present in the markup (manifestation), because the information is not defined in the original document, or it doesn't exist in some legal tradition (e.g. an anonymous speech cannot specify the attribute by, or some publications do not record the numbering of the items, etc.) - ignored: the content of the element or the value of a required attribute is NOT present in the markup (manifestation) because the information exists but the author of the manifestation is not interested in reporting it (e.g., omitted parts of the document due to editorial reasons, etc.)

desc.name: temporalGroupRef
desc.comment: These values are references to existing temporal groups only, i.e., given an existing eId of a temporal group of the form XYZ, the value is necessarily #XYZ

desc.name: timeType
desc.comment: This is the list of allowed values for the type attribute of the recordedTime element for the specification of an explicit mention of a time (e.g., in a debate)

desc.name: versionType
desc.comment: This is the list of allowed values for the contains attribute

desc.name: voteRef
desc.comment: These values are references to existing votes (i.e., quorum or count) only, i.e., given an existing eId of a vote element of the form XYZ, the value is necessarily #XYZ

desc.name: wIdRef
desc.comment: These values are references to existing wIds only, i.e., given an existing wId of the form XYZ, the value is necessarily #XYZ

desc.name: ANblock
desc.comment: The group ANblock lists the elements that are blocks and are specific to the Akoma Ntoso vocabulary

desc.name: ANcontainers
desc.comment: The group ANcontainers lists the elements that are containers and are specific to the Akoma Ntoso debate vocabulary

desc.name: ANheaderInline
desc.comment: The group ANheaderInline lists the elements that are inline, are specific to the Akoma Ntoso vocabulary, and should only be used within the header element

desc.name: ANhier
desc.comment: The group ANhier lists the elements that belong to the Akoma Ntoso legislative hierarchy

desc.name: ANinline
desc.comment: The group ANinline lists the elements that are inline and are specific to the Akoma Ntoso vocabulary

desc.name: ANmarker
desc.comment: The group ANmarker lists the elements that are markers and are specific to the Akoma Ntoso vocabulary

desc.name: ANsemanticInline
desc.comment: The group ANsemanticInline lists additional elements that are inline, and are specific to the Akoma Ntoso vocabulary

desc.name: ANsubFlow
desc.comment: The group ANsubFlow lists the elements that are subFlows and are specific to the Akoma Ntoso vocabulary

desc.name: ANtitleInline
desc.comment: The group ANtitleInline lists the elements that are inline, are specific to the Akoma Ntoso vocabulary, and should only be used within the initial elements (preface, preamble and coverpage)

desc.name: HTMLblock
desc.comment: The group HTMLblock lists the elements that are blocks and were inherited from the HTML vocabulary

desc.name: HTMLcontainers
desc.comment: The group HTMLcontainers lists the elements that are containers and were inherited from the HTML vocabulary

desc.name: HTMLinline
desc.comment: The group HTMLinline lists the elements that are inline and were inherited from the HTML vocabulary

desc.name: HTMLmarker
desc.comment: The group HTMLmarker lists the elements that are marker and were inherited from the HTML vocabulary

desc.name: TLCs
desc.comment: The group TLCs is a list of types of Top Level classes of the Akoma Ntoso ontology.

desc.name: amendmentBlock
desc.comment: The group amendmentBlock lists the structures that should be found in an amendment

desc.name: amendmentInline
desc.comment: The group amendmentInline lists the inline elements that should be found in the preface of an amendment

desc.name: basicContainers
desc.comment: The group basicContainers lists the elements that are containers and are specific to vocabulary of preambles, prefaces, conclusions and coverPages

desc.name: blockElements
desc.comment: The group blockElements lists all the elements that are blocks

desc.name: containerElements
desc.comment: The group containerElements lists all the elements that are containers

desc.name: docRefs
desc.comment: The group docrefs is a list of types of legal references to documents.

desc.name: documentType
desc.comment: the type documentType lists all the document types that are managed by Akoma Ntoso

desc.name: exprProperties
desc.comment: The group exprProperties lists the properties that are characteristics of the FRBR Expression level.

desc.name: hierElements
desc.comment: The group hierElements lists all the elements that are hierarchical

desc.name: inlineCM
desc.comment: The group inlineCM is the content model of blocks and inlines, and is composed of all the inlines and all the markers

desc.name: inlineElements
desc.comment: The group inlineElements lists all the elements that are inline

desc.name: judgmentBlock
desc.comment: The group judgmentBlock lists the structures that should be found in a judgment

desc.name: manifProperties
desc.comment: The group manifProperties lists the properties that are characteristics of the FRBR Manifestation level.

desc.name: markerElements
desc.comment: The group markerElements lists all the elements that are markers

desc.name: preambleContainers
desc.comment: The group preambleContainers lists the elements that are containers and are specific to the Akoma Ntoso preamble vocabulary

desc.name: prefaceContainers
desc.comment: The group prefaceContainers lists the elements that are containers and are specific to the Akoma Ntoso preface vocabulary

desc.name: speechSection
desc.comment: The group speechSection lists the structures that should contain speeches

desc.name: subFlowElements
desc.comment: The group subFlowElements lists all the elements that are subFlows

desc.name: workProperties
desc.comment: The group workProperties lists the properties that are characteristics of the FRBR Work level.

div.p: denotes an attribute whose value provides a URI to be used as the base for interpreting any relative URIs in the scope of the element on which it appears; its value is inherited. This name is reserved by virtue of its definition in the XML Base specification.
See http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlbase/ for information about this attribute.
denotes an attribute whose value should be interpreted as if declared to be of type ID. This name is reserved by virtue of its definition in the xml:id specification.
See http://www.w3.org/TR/xml-id/ for information about this attribute.

denotes an attribute whose value is a language code for the natural language of the content of any element; its value is inherited. This name is reserved by virtue of its definition in the XML specification.
Attempting to install the relevant ISO 2- and 3-letter codes as the enumerated possible values is probably never going to be a realistic possibility.

See BCP 47 at
http://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/bcp/bcp47.txt and the IANA language subtag registry at
http://www.iana.org/assignments/language-subtag-registry for further information.
The union allows for the 'un-declaration' of xml:lang with the empty string.

denotes an attribute whose value is a keyword indicating what whitespace processing discipline is intended for the content of the element; its value is inherited. This name is reserved by virtue of its definition in the XML specification.

desc.name: HTMLattrs
desc.comment: These attributes are used to specify class, style and title of the element, exactly as in HTML

desc.name: agent
desc.comment: The attribute by is used to identify the agent of an action. It is a reference to a TLCPerson or TLCOrganization element in the references section

desc.name: alt
desc.comment: The attribute alternativeTo is used to specify, when the element contains an alternative version of some content, the eId of the main element which this element is an alternative copy of

desc.name: authoritative
desc.comment: This attribute specifies whether the translation is authoritative or not

desc.name: booleanvalue
desc.comment: The attribute value is used here to specify a boolean value for metadata elements. In elements using this attribute definition the value attribute is required

desc.name: cellattrs
desc.comment: These attributes are used to specify that table cells span more than one row or one column, exactly as in HTML

desc.name: contains
desc.comment: The attribute contains is used in the root of document types to indicate whether the document is original or modified wrt the orignal version

desc.name: core
desc.comment: This attribute list are used to specify the fact that any attribute can be specified for this element if it belongs to a different namespace.

desc.name: coreopt
desc.comment: This is the list of the core attributes that all elements in the content part of the document must have. In elements using this attribute definition both the refersTo attribute and the eId attribute are optional

desc.name: corereq
desc.comment: This is the list of the core attributes that all elements in the content part of the document must have. In elements using this attribute definition the refersTo attribute is optional but the eId attribute is required

desc.name: corereqreq
desc.comment: This is the list of the core attributes that all elements in the content part of the document must have. In elements using this attribute definition both the refersTo attribute and the eId attribute are required

desc.name: date
desc.comment: The attribute date is used to give a normalized value for a date according to the XSD syntax YYYY-MM-DD or a normalized value for a dateTime according to the XSD syntax YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss(zzzz)

desc.name: dictionary
desc.comment: This attribute specifies the eId of the element in the references section detailing the dictionary used for the keyword.

desc.name: enactment
desc.comment: These attributes are those already defined in attribute list "period", plus the attribute status, that allows to specify the status of the piece of text it wraps.

desc.name: fillInWidth
desc.comment: the attribute width of the element fillIn specifies the width of the fillIn element.

desc.name: for
desc.comment: The attribute for is used in modification elements to specify the element this is a modification of.

desc.name: fromLanguage
desc.comment: This attribute specifies the human language of the expression this is a translation of. Values are taken from the RFC 4646.

desc.name: frozen
desc.comment: The attribute frozen for the condition element specifies whether the condition is frozen or not in the time period of this expression.

desc.name: duration
desc.comment: The duration attribute is used to specify a duration when either the start or the end event of a time interval is not known.

desc.name: notes
desc.comment: These attributes are used by notes, both authorial and editorial. The marker is the string to be used as a marker of the note, the placement is the position where the note should be placed, and placementBase is the eId of the element respect to which the note should be placed near.

desc.name: idopt
desc.comment: These attributes identify the element in an absolute manner. In elements using this attribute definition the eId attribute is optional. The wId is used to mark the identifier that the structure used to have in the original version, and is only needed when a renumbering occurred.

desc.name: idreq
desc.comment: These attributes identify the element in an absolute manner. In elements using this attribute definition the eId attribute is required whenever the Akoma Ntoso naming Convention is used.
